Message: Hi, I’m the NewsBreak Ad Assistant. How can I help?
The user completes the submission of the form
How long does it take for my account to be reviewed?

The account review process typically takes between 1-2 business days. If your account is new and pending verification, please ensure you've provided all necessary details for a quicker review. If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com.
I've registered for more than 2 working days

If your account has been pending for more than 2 business days, it might be due to missing information or verification issues. Please ensure you've submitted all required details such as your company's full address, legal entity name, EHID or DUNS number, primary contact person's name, and phone number. You can email these details to adsupport@newsbreak.com with the subject line: Business Verification. This will help expedite the review process.
onsmining@gmail.com Please help me verify what information is needed for this account. I have submitted all the information before.

I understand you've submitted the information before. To ensure everything is in order, please verify that you've included your company's full address, legal entity name, EHID or DUNS number, primary contact person's name, and phone number. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com.

Please help me check if my account has been approved

I don't have access to check the status of your account directly. However, you can reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for assistance regarding your account approval status. They will be able to provide you with the most accurate information.
What does this mean

What does this mean
The "Warning: No active ad sets" status means that your campaign is currently not running any ads because there are no active ad sets associated with it. 

To resolve this, you will need to:

1. **Create an Ad Set:** You'll need to set up at least one active ad set under your campaign. 
2. **Check Ad Set Settings:** Ensure your ad sets meet all requirements and are properly configured.

Once you have at least one active ad set, the warning should change, and your campaign will be able to run ads.

The "Warning: No active ad sets" status indicates that your campaign isn't running any ads because there are no active ad sets linked to it. To fix this, you should:

1. **Create an Ad Set:** Set up at least one active ad set under your campaign.
2. **Check Ad Set Settings:** Make sure your ad sets meet all requirements and are correctly configured.

Once you have at least one active ad set, the warning should disappear, allowing your campaign to run ads.
Where to set it up

To set up an ad set, you'll need to access the Ad Management section of your NewsBreak account. Here's a quick guide:

1. **Access Ad Management:** Log into your NewsBreak account and navigate to the Ad Management section.
2. **Create Campaign:** Click 'Create Campaign' and choose your campaign objective.
3. **Set Up Ad Set:** Within the campaign setup, you'll find options to create ad sets. Configure your targeting, budget, and schedule here.
4. **Save Settings:** Make sure to save your settings to activate the ad set.

For more detailed instructions, you can refer to this article: [How to create your first ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad).
Isn't this an ad collection?

Isn't this an ad collection?
Yes, you are correct. In your screenshot, "Ad sets" refers to a collection of ads within a campaign. The warning indicates that the ad set "ons001" is not currently set up to deliver ads because it requires an event to be defined for delivery, such as a conversion event.

To resolve this:

1. **Edit Ad Set:** Click on the "Edit" button for the ad set.
2. **Define Events:** Ensure that you define the required events that trigger your ads (e.g., traffic, conversions).
3. **Save Changes:** After making the necessary changes, save the ad set.

Once you've defined the relevant events, the warning should go away, and your ad set will be active for delivery.

Yes, "Ad sets" are indeed a collection of ads within a campaign. The warning indicates that the ad set "ons001" isn't set up to deliver ads because it needs an event defined for delivery, like a conversion event.

To fix this:

1. **Edit Ad Set:** Click on the "Edit" button for the ad set.
2. **Define Events:** Make sure you define the necessary events that trigger your ads (e.g., traffic, conversions).
3. **Save Changes:** After making the changes, save the ad set.

Once you've defined the relevant events, the warning should disappear, and your ad set will be active for delivery.
Why does this appear

Why does this appear
The message is appearing because you haven't selected an event to track for your ad set. This means that your ads won’t be delivered until you specify what action you want to track, such as clicks, conversions, or impressions.

To resolve this:

1. **Go Back to Edit:** Click on "Go back to edit."
2. **Select an Event:** Look for the section where you can choose an event to track. Select the appropriate event that aligns with your campaign goals.
3. **Save Changes:** After selecting the event, make sure to save your changes.

Once you’ve selected an event, you should be able to proceed without seeing that message again.

The message appears because you haven't selected an event to track for your ad set. Without specifying an action to track, like clicks, conversions, or impressions, your ads won't be delivered.

To fix this:

1. **Go Back to Edit:** Click on "Go back to edit."
2. **Select an Event:** Find the section where you can choose an event to track and select the one that aligns with your campaign goals.
3. **Save Changes:** After selecting the event, make sure to save your changes.

Once you've selected an event, you should be able to proceed without seeing that message again.
Can you please review it now?

Can you please review it now?
I can't directly review the content of your ad, but from your screenshot, it appears that your ad "ons" is currently marked as "Pending." This status means your ad is still under review and hasn't been approved yet.

Typically, the review process takes about 1-2 business days. If the status remains pending for longer than that, consider reaching out to support for clarification.

You can still proceed with any necessary edits while it's under review. If you've already addressed any previous issues (like defining tracking events), that should help ensure a smoother approval process once it resumes.

Is this ad successfully set?

I can't directly check the status of your ad setup, but if you've followed all the necessary steps, such as creating an ad set, defining tracking events, and saving your changes, your ad should be successfully set. If you're still unsure or facing issues, you can reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for further assistance.
Can you contact us if you have any telegrams or WHATSAPP or other contact information?
Currently, the best way to contact NewsBreak support is via email at adsupport@newsbreak.com. We don't have support through Telegram, WhatsApp, or other messaging platforms at this time.
Why does my ad not meet the standards

Ads can be rejected for various reasons, such as incorrect conversion tracking setup, typographical errors, or not adhering to advertising policies. You should have received an email from Ad Support detailing the specific reason for your ad's rejection. I recommend checking that email for more information.

For further guidance, you can refer to this article: [My ad got rejected. What's next?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18085960681101-My-ad-got-rejected-What-s-next)

I did not receive any email


For further guidance, you can refer to this article:

If you haven't received an email regarding your ad rejection, I recommend checking your spam or junk folder to ensure it wasn't filtered there. If you still can't find it, you can reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for assistance.

For more information on what to do next, you can refer to this article: [My ad got rejected. What's next?](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18085960681101-My-ad-got-rejected-What-s-next)
Show this

Show this
It looks like your ad has been rejected due to a violation of the Advertising Policy. The message indicates that the product associated with your ad does not comply with the advertising guidelines, which prevents it from being approved.

To resolve this, you'll need to:

1. **Review the Advertising Policies:** Familiarize yourself with the specific policies that apply to your type of ad.
2. **Select Another Product:** Consider advertising a different product that complies with the guidelines.
3. **Resubmit the Ad:** After making the necessary changes, resubmit your ad for review.

If you need further clarification, it's a good idea to reach out to adsupport@newsbreak.com for specific guidance related to your situation.
